result.execSummary:
The defendant Renae A Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution will be Joint/Several with:
Scott M Rathbun, Rusk County Case No. 15CM101
Stephen Schultz, Rusk County Case No. 15CM103

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

 No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Any perscribed medications will be taken only as directed.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will have approval of DOC agent if employed in a bar setting.

Defendant Renae A Richardson in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE would like to apply to PD for representation.  Court will adjourn to 7-27-15 @ 1:00PM.  $500.00 sign bond, no contact with Gale Javne, Scott Rathbun, Stephen Schultz.

Defendant Renae A Richardson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM102, 15CM109.  Agreement has been reached in these matters.  Atty Bahnson recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF120-amend Ct 1, DE enters a plea of NC,
                 Ct 2-DRI
15CM102-NC
15CM109-NC- Court will accept all and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court will order 18 month probation, DE will complete an AODA/Drug assessment, no alcohol possession or consumption, no bars, taverns or liquor stores, no illicit substances, DE will pay restitition of $150.00 J/S with co-defendant, will pay CC, DNA sample and surcharge.
